#summary features of the Graphical User Interface

= Introduction =

The Graphical User Interface (GUI) was first introduced in version 0.3.0.  It is only capable of displaying a BDF.

An early version of the GUI looks like:

https://pynastran.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/pyNastran/gui/guiDemo.png

The plan is to replace the right hand side with OP2 results...

= Supported Elements =
 * CQUAD4 / CQUAD8 (CQUAD5/6/7 represented as CQUAD4)
 * CTRIA3 / CTRIA6
 * CTETRA4 / CTETRA10
 * CHEXA8 / CHEXA20
 * CPENTA6 / CPENTA15
 * CBAR/CBEAM/CROD/CONROD/CELASx (displayed as lines)
 * CAERO1 (shown in yellow)
 * CONM2 (shown in yellow as points)
 

= BDF Requirements =
 * Entire model can be cross-referenced
 * No SPOINTs
 * Same requirements as BDF

= Features =
 * Load BDF file window (button)
 * Wireframe Mode (button/keyboard)
 * Surface/Solid Mode (button/keyboard)
 * Take a Screenshot (button/keyboard)
 * Snap to Axis (keyboard)
 * Change Background Color (button)

= Limitations =
 * Edges may be displayed with command line option, but may not be switched once the GUI is loaded
 * No results


= Keyboard Controls =

|| *Command* || *Purpose* ||
|| Left Mouse Button || Rotate in 3D ||
|| Right Mouse Button || Zoom In/Out ||
|| Middle Mouse Button || Pan ||
|| i || Take a Picture (Image) ||
|| m/M || Increase/decrease magnification 1.1 times ||
|| o/O || Rotate clockwise/counter-clockwise 5 degrees ||
|| s   || Display surface mode    ||
|| w   || Display wireframe mode  ||
|| x/X || Snap to x/-x axis ||
|| y/Y || Snap to y/-y axis ||
|| z/Z || Snap to z/-z axis ||


== Desired Keyboard Controls ==
|| Left/Right/Up/Down Arrow || Pan ||
|| f || Set rotation center (zoom out before pressing to avoid clipping )||
|| p || Pick a point ||
|| e || Pick an element ||
|| d || Display element edges ||
